    Exercise1
    Name: Paul Chang Yong Kim
    Email: ksense1210@gmail.com
    Recruiter: Emma Peterson at TekSystems
    TODO: Make this class immutable
    Exercise1.Person
    First, declare the class final by adding final keyword
    Second, declare all instance fields private final
    Third, remove all setter methods
    Lastly, Modify constructor to set the fields upon instantiation
    Reason: The reason for adding private and final keywords to class and field names is because
    we don't want to let anything change the state of the instance hence, we would need to add
    final keyword for all fields to be immutable.
    Exercise2
    TODO refactor the Car to use dependency injection of the engine TODO allow use of either a gas engine or electric engine (create an appropriate abstraction) TODO make sure we have no-op implementations of the gas engine and electric engine
    Exercise2.Car
    Create interface IEngine with void method "spinWheels"
    Create ElectricEngine class that implements IEngine, along with the method
    Implement IEngine for GasEngine class as well along with the method
    Change instance variable type in Car class to be IEngine without any instantiation
    In Car constructor, add the parameter IEngine and set the instance field for dependency injection
    The steps above allows appropriate abstraction through dependency injection because IEngine can either be GasEngine or ElectricEngine in which will define the Car class by the injected dependency.

    The reason why the size of the set people were two is because on line 29, the method would always return a different number regardless of whether the objects are the same that are already existing in the set.
    Exercise3Test  
    Exercise4
    Counter class is thread safe because it is declared static, however the instance variable count and the methods of incrementing the count variable is not because multiple threads can call the methods which can change the instance variable The solution to this would be either to set synchronization the methods by adding synchronized keyword or to set the instance variable count to be final and increment method to synchronized.
    Exercise4.Counter

    TODO: Turn the "Singleton" class into an actual singleton.
    Exercise5.Singleton
    1. Add a new instance variable of the class itself so that the class has only one instance
    2. Create a new method that returns the current instance of itself, if none exists (will always be the first time), create a new instance
    3. Instantiate the singleton class by the method created
